intro: Pasania encleisacarpa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed pasania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Indonesia and Malaysia. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
